techmeme.title: In the first day of the antitrust trial focused on ads, US prosecutors allege Google abused its size to dominate the sector through acquisitions and more (Jody Godoy/Reuters)
Oracle and AWS debut Oracle Database@AWS, to let customers access select Oracle products within AWS, following Oracle's partnerships with Azure and Google Cloud (Larry Dignan/Constellation Research)
Testing the Apple Intelligence beta shows the pre-release software still has a long way to go, with hallucinations, marking spam emails as priority, and more (Geoffrey A. Fowler/Washington Post)
HyperWrite's 70B parameter AI model, Reflection, has its performance questioned, after CEO Matt Shumer said something about its upload to Hugging Face was off (Carl Franzen/VentureBeat)
Oracle reports Q1 revenue of $13.31B, up 7% YoY, vs. $13.23B est., with revenue from cloud infrastructure of $2.2B, up 45% YoY; ORCL jumps 8%+ after hours (Jordan Novet/CNBC)
